abstract.p: Tottenville of Staten Island will play against Monroe of the Bronx for Public Schools Athletic League baseball championship (S)

block.p: Tottenville of Staten Island will square off against Monroe of the Bronx for the Public Schools Athletic League baseball championship next Monday morning at Yankee Stadium.

That matchup was assured yesterday when Tottenville beat Madison of Brooklyn, 7-2, at the College of Staten Island in one semifinal, and Monroe eliminated Canarsie of Brooklyn, 6-4, at Cardozo High in Queens in the other semifinal.
Tottenville of Staten Island will square off against Monroe of the Bronx for the Public Schools Athletic League baseball championship next Monday morning at Yankee Stadium.

That matchup was assured yesterday when Tottenville beat Madison of Brooklyn, 7-2, at the College of Staten Island in one semifinal, and Monroe eliminated Canarsie of Brooklyn, 6-4, at Cardozo High in Queens in the other semifinal.

In stunning top-seeded Madison, Tottenville did all of its scoring in a seven-run third inning. A two-run double by Matt Hegels was the big blow. The Pirates right-hander Ray Rodriguez continually pitched himself into and out of trouble before settling down after four innings and completing the game.
Monroe gained the final by jumping to a 6-0 lead after five innings and then hanging on. Ricky Lech of Canarsie surrendered five of the six runs. The key hit was a two-run homer by Fidel Rodriguez.
